title: Identify the Function of SQL Keywords
text:
Each SQL keyword serves a specific function in a query. Review the common ones:
- 'SELECT' chooses columns to display.
- 'FROM' designates the source table.
- 'WHERE' filters results based on a condition.
- 'AS' renames a column or table.

title: Understanding WHERE Clause
text: The 'WHERE' clause is used to filter records that meet specific conditions. This is crucial when you want results for specific data points only.

title: Use of WHERE Clause
text: Try using the 'WHERE' clause in this example:\nImagine you have a table of employees, and you want to find those who work in the 'Sales' department only. What clause do you apply?

title: Order of SQL Statements
text:
Remember the general order of clauses in an SQL statement:
$$1$$. SELECT: Columns
$$2$$. FROM: Table
$$3$$. WHERE: Condition
This order ensures efficient retrieval and filtering of data.

title: Creating a Complete SQL Query
text:
Starting with data retrieval, design a basic query. You want all sales employees:
$$1$$. Choose columns to display.
$$2$$. Identify the correct table.
$$3$$. Filter for sales department.
